snippet: Lawyers for Staff Sgt. Robert Bales began making their case Wednesday to a military jury that their client should not spend the rest of his life in prison.
abstract: Defense lawyers for Staff Sgt Robert Bales, who has pleaded guilty to killing 16 Afghan civilians, try to soften his image as they begin to make their case that Bales should not spend the rest of his life in prison.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Staff Sgt. Robert Bales began making their case Wednesday to a military jury that their client should not spend the rest of his life in prison.

headline.main: Defense Tries to Soften Image of Soldier Who Killed 16 Afghans
headline.print_headline: Defense Tries to Soften Image of Soldier Who Killed 16
